title.narrative: 2.2 COVERAGE AND QUALITY OF WATER SERVICES

description.narrative: 2.2 Government authorities at all levels have strengthened capacities to improve the coverage and quality of water services for rural and poor urban households and communities., which contributes to Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Reducing Child Poverty, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more children and their families, particularly in rural and poor urban areas, have access to and use affordable and sustainable basic water and sanitation services, and practices safe hygiene behaviors

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF PLANNING AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT

sector.narrative: Overall WASH – systems strengthening (e.g. sector-wide coordination, enabling environment and financing advocacy)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 2.2 Government authorities at all levels have strengthened capacities to improve the coverage and quality of water services forrural and poor urban households and communities.

description.narrative: At the end of 2021, the proportion of people with access to basic drinking water, compared to 2020 increased from 61 to 64 per cent. An additional 95,350 children and their families obtained sustainable and equitable access to basic water supply through the construction and rehabilitation of 113 water systems, implying that the Country Programme is on-track to achieving its targets. To ensure future results, water safety plans have been developed and are being implemented in 27 communities across five districts and WASHCOMs in 194 communities have been empowered to support the operation and maintenance of water supply systems. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
